text: My dog saved my life  Looking back on it  I wish he was still here  years ago I was wildly depressed  distancing myself from friends  family  everything  One day  in the summer excuse the illusivness but any memory past   years for me is faded and blurred  I decided I had enough and sent to the garage to grable my father s old rifle  I cant even begin to explain what I was thinking at that time but whatever it was it was better than being alive  Only thing that has me typing here today is the fact that my dog must have overheard the crying coming from the garage  No barking no scratching at the door  somehow  some way  my dog opened the door circle door handle  not somthing a chocolate lab should be able to open  He just came up to me lying on the garage floor crying and layed down on top if me  A year later  that dogs end came  he had a good run tho  made it to   I woke up one day and gathered my snowboarding shit and as I was about to leave  I overheard some panting  The second he saw me walk into the room  the panting turned into full on heaving  and I instantly knew it was his time  I just sat their with him in my arms  The dog I grew up with  he was as old as I was  From birth to death  always there  The one being on this planet that saved my life has been gone for so long now  I ll never forget the name  Only thing is  I ve felt different since then    years  but different
summary: My dog saved my life when I was depressed. He opened the garage door for me. He died a year later. He was as old as I was and he was always there from birth to death. I will never forget his name.

text: Does anyone know how to be honest with a teacher  So this semester I ve had pretty bad mental health  and I m about to fail my English class  if I don t turn in a ton of late work by   tonight  there s no way I ll pass  and I don t have time to do enough of it until then  I ve always had trouble with procrastinating focusing but I ve never had a class with such a work load  so I ve been pretty much fine until now  I used to get straight A s  when I didn t have to do homework at my old school  I did fail a summer school semester once  but that was more of a miscommunication than anything and I m planning on retaking it next summer I wouldn t call myself a bad student  When I can actually focus  and when my anxiety isn t too bad  I love participating in discussions answering questions etc  And quite honestly  my English teacher is the nicest human being on the planet and I m really thankful that I had her as a teacher  Unfortunately I ve never been able pressure myself into doing ANYTHING  When my brain says no  it means no   With that  I want to apologize to my English teacher for doing so poorly this semester  I m not trying to make excuses and I m not just trying to be lazy  but there s a constant mental block that prevents me from doing assignments I would otherwise enjoy doing  I m not really sure how to do this without sounding like a major AH though   Sorry Ms  P  I know you were kind enough to give me like   chances and I blew them all because I had a bad case of the Big Sad  this entire semester   Any advice  I just want to let her know that I really do care about my education and I m sorry I wasn t able to pass this semester  without giving too many personal details and being weird  I don t need her to know about all my family and mental issues but I m not sure how to explain around them

text: To all the people on this sub who comment under posts or make their own posts to say  No one cares what you did this or whatever  no one asked for your take on the matter either Idk who these people are  or what they think they are  Half of them are not even teenagers for god s sake and are just horny lurkers  I don t think anyone needs to prove that this is one of the most stressful parts of growing up  Teenage years are not easy  as explained by many psychologists and experts not only on this sub  but several others as well  Now I don t want to play the victim card but i m just saying that we do have our own share of issues that even if you can t understand or sympathize with  are pretty important to us  If you do not wish to read about it  no one forced you to  Ignore the post  If you think it s too much  just leave the sub too Just as an example  one of the most common type of these posts is getting into a relationship  Yes  I agree that almost every  rd post is somewhat like this only  But just think for a second  Why would these people be sharing this with random people  Because they don t have anyone else to express their feelings to without judgement  So if you can t be happy for them  just leave them alone  Don t be a butthurt Another trend on this sub is when people break free of their self harming habits and or smoking vaping etc  Yes  a lot of people encourage them to keep going and honestly  it helps a lot  But then comes along some asshole and comments  No OnE cArEs  Just  please  leave them alone   I don t care if this gets downvoted but I seriously wanted this message to be put through because no one was coming forward to say it
summary: Some people comment under posts or make their own posts on a sub without asking for their opinion. Teenagers have their own issues that even if you can't understand or sympathize with them are important to them. If you don't want to read about it, you can ignore the post.
cleaned: people comment post post sub ask opinion teenager issue not understand sympathize important not want read ignore post
